intro: Chloraea gayana, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens around the world.
